intro: Freziera nervosa, commonly known as the veined freziera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Freziera nervosa thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in high-altitude forests.
